citation.article-title: Anderseniella baltica gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel marine bacterium of the Alphaproteobacteria isolated from sediment in the central Baltic Sea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Anderseniella (An.der.sen.i.el′la. N.L. dim. n. Anderseniella named in honour of the late marine scientist Valérie Andersen, Observatoire Océanologique de Villefranche sur Mer, France, in recognition of her valuable work on marine ecosytems).
Cells are Gram-negative, rod-shaped to pleomorphic, and oxidase- and catalase-positive.
Other major fatty acids are 16 : 0 and 19 : 0 cyclo ω8c.
Cells contain carotenoids but not bacteriochlorophyll a.
The type species is Anderseniella baltica.
